47.0#0 2016-07-26
 Major Updates
 + Chinesebrowser HTML codebase is updated to Mozilla Firefox version 47.0.
 + Introduced the following character and pinyin features. See Pinyin Settings.
 * simplified/traditional/as per original character options
 * Hanyu/Bopomofo pinyin options (with numeral tone marking option)
 * pinyin location option
 * pinyin to be shown according to grade settings (Beginner/Junior/Senior)
 + PDF output is now available with pinyin.
 + Page zoom now comes with clamp images and hide floaties features. (can be disabled in settings)
 
 Minor Updates
 + fixed general chinese websites behaviour bugs
 + fixed home page (pin/thumbnail errors)
 + partially fixed bookmark import/export idiosyncrasies.
 + various other minor fixes.
 
 ‎Chinese Fonts‬ if they are missing from your phone will be shown as blank out (black) squares. ‪Chinesebrowser‬ also scans /sdcard/fonts for fonts during start up. You can download some fonts with .ttc or .ttf extensions (eg simsun.ttc) and put it in /sdcard/fonts and the missing font problem will be resolved. There is no rooting requirements or any need to install fonts to the system folders. You can also place other fonts into this same folder /sdcards/fonts.
